title: Working with Ruby threads
author: Jesse Storimer
prompt_headers: In the book 'Working With Ruby Threads', Jesse Storimer offers some insights about how threads work in Ruby
We will provide some of the ideas presented in the book so you can answer questions regarding threads. The answers should be complete sentences, keeping it at a maximum of four sentences
prompt_hints: A thread is a sequencial flow of execution in a program that can happen in parallel with other threads that share the same process memory space.
Yes, the Ruby MRI provides an abstraction to manage concurrent tasks but they are subjected to a global interpreter lock
